metadata.feature_description: Quick edit toolbar for managing posts directly from the view interface

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display edit bar for authorized users

steps.action: Navigate to News page with Publisher module while logged in as SuperUser
steps.expected: Edit Bar should be visible for authorized users
steps.actual: Edit Bar displayed at bottom of page with Settings and Create Post buttons in List View

steps.action: Verify Edit Bar elements are visible
steps.expected: Edit Bar should show appropriate buttons for current view mode
steps.actual: Edit Bar visible with Settings button, Create Post link, and other navigation elements

steps.expected: Edit Bar should display Edit Post button
steps.actual: Edit Bar shows Edit Post button in Detail View

steps.action: Click Edit Post button from Edit Bar
steps.expected: Should navigate to Edit View for the post
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Edit View with inline editing capability

steps.action: Navigate to Edit View and locate Delete button in Edit Bar
steps.expected: Delete button should be visible in Edit Bar
steps.actual: Delete button (trash icon) visible in Edit Bar at bottom of page

steps.action: Click Delete button from Edit Bar
steps.expected: Confirmation dialog should appear before deletion
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared asking 'Do you want to delete the current post?'

steps.action: Make changes to post in Edit View
steps.expected: Edit Bar should show status change options
steps.actual: Edit Bar displays 'Changes shown are not published' message with Publish and Discard buttons

steps.action: Verify Edit Post Details panel for status-related options
steps.expected: Should be able to change post metadata and save
steps.actual: Edit Post Details panel available with Title, Description, URL, Featured checkbox, Tags, and Save/Cancel buttons

steps.action: Log out and navigate to the same post page
steps.expected: Edit Bar should NOT be visible for unauthorized users
steps.actual: Edit Bar is not visible when logged out - only Register/Login links shown in header

steps.action: Resize browser viewport to 480px width (mobile view)
steps.expected: Edit Bar should adapt responsively to smaller screen sizes
steps.actual: Edit Bar is NOT visible at 480px mobile viewport width - appears to be hidden on mobile screens

steps.action: Take full-page screenshot to confirm Edit Bar visibility
steps.expected: Edit Bar should be present somewhere on the page
steps.actual: Full-page screenshot confirms Edit Bar is completely hidden on mobile viewport

issues: Edit Bar is not visible at 480px mobile viewport width
No responsive adaptation of Edit Bar for mobile screens - bar is completely hidden

steps.action: Test Escape key to close Edit Post Details panel
steps.expected: Escape key should close open panels
steps.actual: Escape key successfully closed the Edit Post Details panel

steps.action: Test Tab navigation to Edit Bar buttons
steps.expected: Edit Bar buttons should be keyboard accessible via Tab navigation
steps.actual: Tab navigation works through page elements but Edit Bar buttons (li elements with click bindings) are not natively keyboard accessible - no tabindex or keyboard handlers implemented

issues: No explicit keyboard shortcuts defined in EditBarManager.js
Edit Bar buttons use li elements with Knockout click bindings but lack tabindex attributes
Edit Bar buttons are not keyboard accessible via Tab navigation

observations: Edit Bar uses different button sets based on ViewMode: List View (Settings, Unpublished Posts, Create Post), Detail View (Edit Post), Edit/Create View (Delete, Edit Post Details, Change Author, workflow buttons)
Edit Bar is implemented with Knockout.js data bindings for dynamic UI state management
The View.ascx code shows Edit Bar is appended to document.body via JavaScript with a resize handler to adjust width
Publishing workflow buttons (Submit, Approve, Publish, Reject, Discard, Save) appear based on workflow state
Code review of EditBarManager.js confirms no keyboard shortcut handlers are implemented - only click handlers
